GEF4 Geometry

SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes
Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes.Polygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Geometry
public class Polygon
extends Object
implements Geometry

Represents the geometric shape of a convex polygon. Note that while all manipulations (e.g. within shrink, expand) within this class are based on double precision, all comparisons (e.g. within contains, intersects, equals, etc.) are based on a limited precision (with an accuracy defined within PrecisionUtils) to compensate for rounding effects.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Polygon

public Polygon(double... coordinates)
Constructs a new Polygon from a even-numbered sequence of coordinates. Similar to Polygon(Point...), only that coordinates of points rather than Points are provided.

Parameters:
coordinates - an alternating, even-numbered sequence of x- and y-coordinates, representing the points from which the Polygon is to be created .

Polygon

public Polygon(Point... points)
Constructs a new Polygon from the given sequence of Point s. The Polygon that is created will be automatically closed, i.e. it will not only contain a segment between succeeding points of the sequence but as well back from the last to the first point.

Parameters:
points - a sequence of points, from which the Polygon is to be created.

equals

public boolean equals(Object o)
Overrides:
equals in class Object

equals

public boolean equals(Point[] points)
Checks whether this Polygon and the one that is indirectly given via the given array of points are regarded to be equal. The Polygons will be regarded equal, if they are characterized by the same segments. As a Polygon is always regarded to be closed, the list of points may not have to correspond in each index value, they may also be shifted by a certain offset. Moreover, the vertices of two equally Polygons may be reverted in order.

Parameters:
points - an array of Point characterizing a Polygon to be checked for equality
Returns:
true if the sequence of points that characterize this Polygon and the Polygon indirectly given via the array of points are regarded to form the same segments.

public double[] getCoordinates()
Returns a double array, which represents the sequence of coordinates of the Points that make up this Polygon.

Returns:

rotateCW

public Polygon rotateCW(Angle alpha,
                        Point center)
Rotates this Polygon clock-wise by the given Angle alpha around the given Point center. The rotation is done by
  1. translating this Polygon by the negated Point center
  2. rotating each Point of this Polygon clock-wise by the given Angle angle
  3. translating this Polygon back by the Point center

Parameters:
alpha - The rotation Angle.
center - The Point to rotate around.
Returns:
This (clock-wise-rotated) Polygon object.

rotateCCW

public Polygon rotateCCW(Angle alpha,
                         Point center)
Rotates this Polygon counter-clock-wise by the given Angle alpha around the given Point center. The rotation is done by
  1. translating this Polygon by the negated Point center
  2. rotating each Point of this Polygon counter-clock-wise by the given Angle angle
  3. translating this Polygon back by the Point center

Parameters:
alpha - The rotation Angle.
center - The Point to rotate around.
Returns:
This (counter-clock-wise-rotated) Polygon object.

getPoints

public Point[] getPoints()
Returns a copy of the points that make up this Polygon, where a segment of the Polygon is represented between each two succeeding Points in the sequence, and from the last back to the first.

Returns:
an array of Points representing the points that make up this Polygon

getSegments

public Line[] getSegments()
Returns a sequence of Lines, representing the segments that are obtained by linking each two successive point of this Polygon (including the last and the first one).

Returns:
an array of Lines, representing the segments that make up this Polygon

getTransformed

public Geometry getTransformed(AffineTransform t)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Returns a new Geometry, which represents the given Geometry after the application of the given AffineTransform. In case the AffineTransform may be performed type intrinsic (e.g. scaling on a Rectangle), an object of the same type is returned.

Specified by:
getTransformed in interface Geometry
Parameters:
t - The AffineTransform to be applied
Returns:
A new Geometry object representing this Geometry after the application of the given AffineTransform.
See Also:
Geometry.getTransformed(AffineTransform)

Parameters:
p - the Polygon to test for intersection
Returns:
true in case this Polygon and the given Polygon share at least one common point.

public int[] toSWTPointArray()
Returns an integer array, which represents the sequence of coordinates of the Points that make up this Polygon.

Returns:

scale

public Polygon scale(double factor,
                     Point center)
Scales this Polygon object by the given factor from the given center Point. The scaling is done by
  1. translating this Polygon by the negated center Point
  2. scaling the individual Polygon Points
  3. translating this Polygon back

Parameters:
factor - The scale-factor.
center - The rotation Point.
Returns:
This (scaled) Polygon object.

translate

public Polygon translate(double dx,
                         double dy)
Moves this Polygon horizontally by dx and vertically by dy, then returns this Rectangle for convenience.

Parameters:
dx - Shift along X axis
dy - Shift along Y axis
Returns:
this for convenience

translate

public Polygon translate(Point p)
Moves this Polygon horizontally by the x value of the given Point and vertically by the y value of the given Point, then returns this Rectangle for convenience.

Parameters:
p - Point which provides translation information
Returns:
this for convenience
